p: As shown in Figure 2, the developed preparative HSCCC method was successfully used for the separation of the major metabolites from P. mollicomum essential oil. In the one-step separation process (2 h), it was possible to obtain 150.0 mg of camphene (1), 85.0 mg of camphor (2), 16.2 mg of bornyl acetate (3), and 100.0 mg of ( E)-nerolidol (4). The purities of the four fractions isolated by this HSCCC system were analyzed by GC-FID, whose results revealed camphene (82.0%), camphor (98.5%), bornyl acetate (91.2%), and ( E)-nerolidol (92.8%). The structural identification of the HSCCC peak fractions was obtained by 1H-NMR and 13C-NMR. Thus, the peak fractions 1â€“4 were characterized and identified as camphene (1), camphor (2), bornyl acetate (3), and ( E)-nerolidol (4) respectively.
